txt.en: 'I feel we have done well today, [placeholder]. Our forebears would be proud. We have honoured them as we should have done long ago.'
Lest We Forget
You have honoured the fallen with the story of their ancient battle
'Go to Tharâkh Bazân and tell the story of the forgotten battle.'
Standing before the northern statue
'It is well that you have honoured the valour of our forebears.'
You left the statue

There are three locations in Tharâkh Bazân, where Arnod wishes you to tell the <rgb=#FF0000>story</rgb> of the battles: a northern statue, a southern fountain, and a central statue.\n\nArnod wants you to honour the fallen dwarves of Moria by telling the story of the ancient lost battle at the monuments the dwarves built in Tharâkh Bazân.
You have honoured the fallen with the story of their ancient battle
Arnod is at the eastern end of Tharâkh Bazân.\n\nArnod will want to know that you honoured the ancients by telling the story of their defeat.
Standing before the southern fountain
You left the fountain
You have honoured the fallen with the story of their ancient battle
Standing before the central statue
You left the statue
Tell the story of the ancient battle
Stand before the northern statue
Tell the story of the ancient battle
Stand before the southern fountain
Tell the story of the ancient battle
Stand before the central statue
Talk to Arnod at Tharâkh Bazân
Stirred by the tales of the dwarves' lost battle, Arnod wishes now to honour the memory of the fallen dwarves.

'I want to restore the glory I believe we have lost in denying our history. It is time to tell the tales of past battles in Khazad-dûm. Not to my fellow dwarves, for they will not appreciate them; to truly honour those who have fallen, we must tell our tale to those figures of lore. Of course, this is not truly possible, but we may still honour their memory in another way.

'Go into the gardens and stand before the statues that rest at the centre, and to the north, and before the southern fountain. There, recount the <rgb=#FF0000>story</rgb> of the great battle.

'Those who fell died in battle and in honour. They should forever be remembered for their valour.'
